title: youtube HDR PQ video dont show correctly anymore on MacOS 14.5
content:
HDR videos (specifically smpte2084 (PQ) / bt2020 videos) on youtube don't show correctly since last few updates of firefox on mac M1 & M2 sonoma 14.5. Firefox shows overly bright (almost whitewashed) videos, seems like something changed either with MacOS or firefox in last few updates. Firefox was working fine on older MacOS last 2 years with HDR videos.

Here is a link to test this problem on Mac, Safari shows the same video correctly in HDR https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s52wB4lKLeo

Kindly fix this problem soon.

title: Failed download with many 30+ tabs
content:
I am opening many images from a gallery into new tabs. Each tab contains at least one image ranging size typically from 1MB to 20MB. When I open a certain amount (maybe around 20), I can no longer save the image by clicking the image and dragging to my desktop. It saves ~4.1KB of the file, then stops. So I am left with an incomplete file. This also occurs when right-clicking and save as (except in this case, the the download message says "Failed"). However, if I click on the retry icon, it will then work. If I open the image directly into in a new tab, I can successfully save using both of the earlier methods.

I was wondering if there is some setting in Firefox that is doing this. I am using a somewhat fresh installation of Firefox (installed a few days ago). I have some extensions, but the issue persisted when they were disabled.

title: Firefox won't connect to Nine News
content:
Please fix this problem Firefox won't connect to Nine News but Edge will. I am using windows 10 and Norton 360 , the error message is :- An error occurred during a connection to t.e.nine.com.au PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR Error code PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the receiver could not be verified. Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem. I have sent this email to Nine with no reply .If you can't fix this problem I will have to make EDGE my browser, but I would prefer to stay with you.

Regards Ken
creator: toaka_2

title: How to decrease the height of the tabs headers?
content:
Hi,

In another occasions I've been shown how to change the tabs' headers' width. I now need to reduce the height of even better fix it to a specific value that won't change even if I customize the scale factor in Windows. Which is what happens atm. I increased the scale factor (recommended was 150, I used 175 for a while, now my eyes got worse and I need to constantly reach for my laptop when I use the folders explorer (where I can't change the zoom level like I can in Firefox. Or, I can but it only affects the kind of view, details, list, small icon, large icon etc. The text stays the same). And once I increased the scale factor, now the tabs headers and the address bar became super big and take too much space. If changing the height of the address bar is not possible ,at least the tabs header? I don't find anything in about:config when I look for browser.tabs

Thanks!
creator: AlternativeTotal2211
